title: iPhone 17 release date: Here’s when to expect Apple’s big launch
description: Apple’s iPhone 17 release date is fast approaching. Here’s when to expect the new iPhone 17, iPhone 17 Air, and iPhone 17 Pro and Pro Max.
content:
It’s been almost a year since Apple’s flagship iPhone 16 lineup debuted. That means the iPhone 17 release date is fast approaching. Here’s when to expect Apple’s new iPhone 17, iPhone 17 Air, iPhone 17 Pro, and iPhone 17 Pro Max to launch.

Apple products all have their own release cadence. Some go years between updates, while others launch new hardware annually.

Out of all Apple product launches, the iPhone is the most consistent.

Every year, new iPhones debut around the same time—give or take a week. First they’re unveiled in a big media event, then they ship about a week and a half later.

This has been true for years. Here are the last several iPhone announcement dates:

Based on this pattern, we can expect Apple to announce the new iPhone 17 lineup the week of September 8.

It could be that Monday the 8th, or perhaps Tuesday the 9th. Apple tends to favor Tuesdays for iPhone launches, but last year opted for Monday—presumably to avoid the U.S. Presidential Debate on Tuesday.

When to expect iPhone 17 to officially release

Unlike the slight variation in new iPhones’ announcement day, their official launch day is even more precise and consistent.

Apple always ships its new iPhones on a Friday. Not the same week the announcement is made, but the Friday that follows that.

Thus, the iPhone 17 release date is expected to be Friday, September 19 this year.

Looking at Apple’s history with recent iPhone launches confirms this pattern.

Regardless of the exact day of the week the iPhone 17 announcement falls on, pre-orders should begin that Friday, with the official release date the following Friday.

For an overview of new features expected in Apple’s upcoming models:

To summarize, Apple follows a very predictable and consistent pattern with flagship iPhone launches.

Based on that pattern, we should expect the following:

Which new iPhone 17 model do you plan to buy? Let us know in the comments.
• AirPods Pro 2 (now only $169, down from $249)
summary: Apple's upcoming iPhone 17 release date is September 19, almost a year since the release of its flagship iPhone 16 lineup. The company's official launch day is typically a Friday, not the same week the announcement is made. This is consistent with Apple's tradition of launching new iPhones around the same time as the media event. The release date should be followed by pre-orders on the Friday following the announcement. The AirPods Pro 2 is expected to be unveiled soon, with prices set at $169.
shortSummary: Apple’s upcoming iPhone 17 release date is expected to be Friday, September 19, with a consistent cadet pattern, unlike previous launches like this one.

Next month, the iPhone lineup is getting a brand new model: the iPhone 17 Air. Per various reports, Apple plans to drop its Plus option in favor of an ultra-thin new form factor that could tempt a lot of Pro users. Here are seven features coming to the iPhone 17 Air.
Ultra-thin form factor
Following the trend started by Apple’s M4 iPad Pro, the iPhone 17 Air’s defining feature will be its thinness.
Per Ming-Chi Kuo and various other reports, iPhone 17 Air will be just 5.55mm thin. Presumably, this measurement does not include the camera bar.
This is a massive reduction from current iPhones. The 16 Pro models are 8.25mm thick, while the base 16 and 16 Plus are 7.8mm.
Apple’s thinnest model ever was the iPhone 6, and even that was 6.9mm.
New 6.6-inch display
Being ultra-thin won’t be the 17 Air’s only hardware advantage over the Pro line. Apple will also give its new model a unique display that could offer the perfect compromise between existing sizes.
Apple’s iPhone 17 Pro and Pro Max will feature 6.3-inch and 6.9-inch displays, respectively. These are the same sizes as the 16 Pro line.
iPhone 17 Air, however, will slot in exactly halfway between the two models with a 6.6-inch display. Thanks to its ultra-thin form factor, the 17 Air’s display may still feel small enough for current Pro users while offering just enough space to satisfy Pro Max fans too.
Always On and high refresh rate features
Ever since 2022, a big difference between Apple’s entry models and Pro line has involved two display features:
- Pro models boast an Always On display
- they also support the 120Hz ProMotion high refresh rate
These are the kind of features that, once you get used to them, are hard to go without.
Fortunately, for the first time, Always On and a version of ProMotion are expected to hit the base iPhone 17 and 17 Air.
I say ‘a version of’ because rumors have swirled about a possible 90Hz refresh rate display being in the works at Apple. No credible rumor has indicated this will hit the 17 Air, so it’s likely it will get the full 120Hz ProMotion feature.
A19 Pro chip
Apple giving a new chip to its latest iPhone is always a given. But iPhone 17 Air chip rumors are especially intriguing.
For a while, consensus was that the base iPhone 17 and 17 Air would get an A19 chip, while the 17 Pro and Pro Max alone get A19 Pro.
Recently though, a leaker suggested Apple is putting the A19 Pro in the iPhone 17 Air too—but with one GPU core disabled.
How much difference will there ultimately be between these various A19 chips? Probably not a lot for everyday tasks.
New design with single rear 48MP camera and four colors
As seen in the dummy models above, the iPhone 17 Air is expected to differ from its siblings substantially in the design and camera departments.
While the 17 Pro line again offers three rear cameras, and the base model two, the 17 Air will feature only one: the main 48MP ‘Fusion’ camera.
Rumors have been minimal around this camera’s features, which could indicate it will be very similar to the existing main camera on the iPhone 16 line.
As for the rest of the design, expect four color options:
- Black
- Silver
- Light Gold
- Light Blue
24MP front camera
Currently, the iPhone’s selfie camera is only 12MP—and gets clearly inferior results to the rear cameras.
Fortunately, Apple is bringing a welcome 24MP upgrade to the front camera on the iPhone 17 Air and all other iPhone 17 models.
The new front camera is still unlikely to match the quality of the rear camera, but it should at least close the gap substantially.
Apple’s in-house C1 modem
Finally, there’s a connectivity change coming to the iPhone 17 Air that could help boost battery life a bit.
Apple’s in-house C1 modem debuted earlier this year in the iPhone 16e, bringing several benefits including a battery improvement.
Out of the full iPhone 17 lineup, only the iPhone 17 Air will get the new C1 modem.
iPhone 17 Air features: wrap-up
The iPhone 17 Air will no doubt be the most exciting fourth model in Apple’s lineup to date. Where the iPhone mini and Plus had their niche groups of loyal fans, the 17 Air seems likely to set the future tone for iPhone design. It’s going to be a fun iPhone 17 launch season.
Which iPhone 17 Air features are you most excited about? Do you plan to buy the new model? Let us know in the comments.

It’s going to be a big fall for Apple, with 15+ new products expected—including the ultra-thin iPhone 17 Air. But what about Apple’s flagship Pro models? Here are seven new features coming to the iPhone 17 Pro and Pro Max.
A19 Pro chip
Apple will once again upgrade its new iPhones with a new and improved A-series chip. This year that will be the A19 Pro chip.
Apple’s very best silicon will be reserved exclusively for the 17 Pro and Pro Max, though the new 17 Air model is rumored to come with a modified variant. The standard A19 chip will be included in the base iPhone 17.
24MP front-facing camera and 48MP telephoto
The iPhone’s cameras get better every year, but often Apple’s big improvements focus solely on rear cameras.
With the full iPhone 17 line, though, Apple plans to upgrade the front camera from a 12MP sensor to a brand new 24MP sensor, which should bring big improvements.
As for the rear cameras, the telephoto lens will get bumped to 48MP—making all three rear cameras 48MP.
12GB RAM, the most ever in an iPhone
The advent of AI has made RAM in Apple’s devices increasingly important. iPhone 15 owners know this better than anyone, since RAM limitations made the device incompatible with Apple Intelligence.
Apple plans to give its 17 Pro and 17 Pro Max models 12GB of RAM—the most ever in an iPhone.
This is a nice 50% improvement from the 16 Pro’s 8GB of RAM and should ensure faster performance with Apple Intelligence and other demanding tasks.
Anti-reflective, more scratch-resistant display
Even though the iPhone 17 Air and base model are likely to gain certain display features that were formerly Pro-exclusive, Apple has some new upgrades coming to its Pro line to make up for that.
iPhone 17 Pro and Pro Max are rumored to feature a new anti-reflective, more scratch-resistant display.
Think something along the lines of nano-texture’s benefits, but without the drawbacks of being so delicate that it needs a special polishing cloth.
Largest battery ever in iPhone 17 Pro Max
Lots of Pro Max users love the bulk and size of the huge iPhone.
This year, iPhone 17 Pro Max is getting thicker than ever to pack an even larger battery.
Rumors indicate the iPhone 17 Pro battery will stay about the same as last year’s. But if you want the most possible battery life in an iPhone, the Pro Max is becoming a better option than ever.
New design with aluminum, camera bar, and bolder colors
Like Apple did with its 16 Pro models, the company is ready to double down on its Pro line being especially optimized for camera use. The iPhone 17 Pro and Pro Max will reportedly replace the traditional camera bump with a camera ‘bar’ instead.
Both models are also getting a redesigned frame, with aluminum replacing titanium. Apple just recently introduced titanium to the iPhone’s Pro models in 2023, so the shift to aluminum is especially curious.
One apparent benefit of adopting aluminum will be bolder Pro colors this year, with Orange and Dark Blue rumored to join the standard Black and Silver options.
Improved cooling with vapor chamber
Finally, the full iPhone 17 lineup is expected to get improved cooling systems, with the iPhone 17 Pro Max exclusively boasting a vapor chamber plus graphite sheet.
No doubt this move is a reflection of Apple Intelligence’s importance to the iPhone’s future. AI not only requires more powerful chips and extra RAM, but better cooling to maintain max performance too.
iPhone 17 Pro features: wrap-up
This list of iPhone 17 Pro features reiterates my belief that this year’s purchase decision will be harder than ever. The ultra-thin iPhone 17 Air sounds very exciting. But depending on your priorities, there’s no doubt that iPhone 17 Pro and Pro Max will continue offering the best overall package.
Which iPhone 17 Pro features are you most excited about? Let us know in the comments.

Apple’s iPhone 17 lineup is launching very soon, bringing four models including the ultra-thin iPhone 17 Air, and strong upgrades to the Pro line. Here’s what’s coming with the new iPhone 17 lineup based on the latest rumors.
iPhone 17
Last year, the iPhone 16 was one of the most compelling base models yet. iPhone 17 may not have as packed a list of new features as what’s coming to other models, but it appears ready to continue that trend nonetheless.
- 6.3-inch screen: Slightly larger display, similar to iPhone 16 Pro size.
- A19 chip: New chip with incremental improvements over last year.
- 24MP front-facing TrueDepth camera: The first selfie camera upgrade in years.
- ProMotion and always-on display: Formerly Pro-exclusive dynamic refresh rate features.
- Refreshed color lineup: Purple, Green, Blue, Black, and White.
- $799 price expected: The same as last year’s iPhone 16.
iPhone 17 Air
A brand new ultra-thin iPhone 17 Air will replace the Plus model in Apple’s lineup. It will prioritize form over function, with a futuristic design that’s thinner than ever, but sacrificing battery life and cameras in the process.
- Ultra-thin form factor: Just 5.55mm thick, easily the thinnest iPhone ever.
- 6.6-inch display: New screen size slots right in the middle of Pro and Pro Max.
- A19 Pro chip w/ reduced GPU count: Apple’s more powerful chip, but binned with only five GPU cores.
- 24MP front-facing TrueDepth camera: The first selfie camera upgrade in years.
- One rear camera: Only the Main camera, no Ultra Wide or Telephoto.
- 12GB RAM: 50% increase over prior models’ 8GB.
- ProMotion and always-on display: Formerly Pro-exclusive dynamic refresh rate features.
- C1 modem: Apple’s first in-house 5G modem.
- Colors inspired by other Air products: Light Blue, Light Gold, Black, and Silver.
- $949 price expected: $50 price increase over last year’s Plus model.
iPhone 17 Pro and iPhone 17 Pro Max
Apple’s Pro models will continue being the best possible all-around iPhones this year. iPhone 17 Pro and Pro Max will come in the same 6.3-inch and 6.9-inch sizes as last year, but a lot of other features are changing.
- New design: Full-width camera bar expands typical bump, and aluminum replaces titanium.
- A19 Pro chip: The most powerful new iPhone chip with no compromises.
- 24MP front-facing TrueDepth camera: The first selfie camera upgrade in years.
- 48MP upgraded Telephoto camera: Up from 12MP, making all three rear cameras now 48MP.
- Larger battery on Pro Max only: The king in battery life will extend its lead.
- 12GB RAM: 50% increase over prior models’ 8GB.
- Anti-reflective, more scratch resistant display: New upgrades to account for loss of ProMotion exclusivity.
- More colorful colors: Orange and Dark Blue will join Silver and Black.
- $1,049 and $1,249 prices expected: $50 price increases over last year.
Apple’s iPhone 17 lineup: summary
The iPhone 17 lineup, thanks largely to the addition of the 17 Air, might make it harder than usual to choose the best model for you. Those considering the base iPhone 17 will get the benefit of ProMotion for the first time ever. iPhone 17 Air will feel the most futuristic, but also come with some compromises. And while iPhone 17 Pro and Pro Max sound as strong as ever, they don’t have the same “brand new” appeal that the Air might.
Which iPhone 17 model do you plan to buy? Let us know in the comments.

argos_summary: Apple is set to launch its iPhone 17 lineup, including the new ultra-thin iPhone 17 Air, expected to be announced around September 8 and officially released on September 19. The iPhone 17 Air will feature a 5.55mm thickness, a 6.6-inch display, and a single 48MP rear camera, while the Pro models will boast the new A19 Pro chip, enhanced camera capabilities, and improved RAM. The entire lineup will introduce significant upgrades, including ProMotion and always-on display features to the base model for the first time.
